content: Hi, I've downloaded the rust repo and successfully compiled it on my computer with python.exe .\x.py build, but when I open the core crate on VSCode, doing cargo check reports me a few compilation errors (https://pastebin.com/uXAyctQJ). Are there additionnal steps required to be able to compile the core crate directly using cargo ?
AFAIK, you can't use cargo at all. Instead of cargo check, you use ./x.py check

Oh ok, thanks!
Is it the same for the tests ? python.exe .\x.py test, because I also get an error when doing so https://pastebin.com/5HKn1sqC

Yeah, it's the same for tests. I believe that error code means that the test harness found an lldb on your path and was trying to run it but there is some dynamically linked dependency of lldb that isn't available.
Removing LLVM from my PATH made it work
You can use https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/building/suggested.html#configuring-rust-analyzer-for-rustc for setting up VS Code for working on rustc
